properties_manager

Class XMLUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • properties_manager.XMLUtilities

  • public class XMLUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides general purpose utilities for the loading and extracting of data from XML Files. This class is useful for the validation and loading of XML docs and for easy extraction of data from. Note that it to be a really useful library it would need to be extended a bit, with some more similar functionality added.

    • Method Detail

      • validateXMLDoc

        public boolean validateXMLDoc(java.lang.String xmlDocNameAndPath,
                              java.lang.String xmlSchemaNameAndPath)
        This method validates the xmlDocNameAndPath doc against the xmlSchemaNameAndPath schema and returns true if valid, false otherwise. Note that this is taken directly (with comments) from this example on the IBM site with only slight modifications.
        Parameters:
        xmlDocNameAndPath - XML Doc to validate
        xmlSchemaNameAndPath - XML Schema to use in validation
        Returns:
        true if the xml doc is validate, false if it does not.

      • loadXMLDocument

        public org.w3c.dom.Document loadXMLDocument(java.lang.String xmlFile,
                                            java.lang.String xsdFile)
                                     throws InvalidXMLFileFormatException
        This method reads in the xmlFile, validates it against the schemaFile, and if valid, loads it into a WhitespaceFreeXMLDoc and returns it, which helps because that's a much easier format for us to deal with.
        Parameters:
        xmlFile - Path and name of xml file to load.
        xsdFile - Path and name of schema file to use for validation.
        Returns:
        A normalized Document object fully loaded with the data found in the xmlFile.
        Throws:
        InvalidXMLFileFormatException - Thrown if the xml file validation fails.

      • getTextData

        public java.lang.String getTextData(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                    java.lang.String tagName)
        This method extracts the data found in the doc argument that corresponds to the tagName and returns it as text. If no data is found, null is returned. Note that this method is only good for elements that are unique to an XML file, meaning there is only one of them.
        Parameters:
        doc - Fully-loaded DOM Document corresponding to a loaded XML file from which we are loading the data.
        tagName - Name of the tag (i.e. field name) we are looking to load data for.
        Returns:
        The data in the doc that corresponds to the tagName element. Note that if no data is found, null is returned.

      • getNodeWithName

        public org.w3c.dom.Node getNodeWithName(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                        java.lang.String tagName)
        This method can be used to get the node in the document that is an element of type tagName. null is returned if none is found.
        Parameters:
        doc - The XML document to search
        tagName - The name of the XML element/tag to search for.
        Returns:
        The first node found named tagName. If none is found in the document, null is returned.

      • getChildNodesWithName

        public java.util.ArrayList<org.w3c.dom.Node> getChildNodesWithName(org.w3c.dom.Node parent,
                                                                   java.lang.String tagName)
        Method for accessing a child node of the parent node argument that is of type tagname.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent node, whose children will be searched.
        tagName - The child node tag name we're looking for.
        Returns:
        The child node of type tagName, null if it's not found.

      • getIntData

        public java.lang.Integer getIntData(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                    java.lang.String tagName)
        This method extracts the data found in the doc argument that corresponds to the tagName and returns it as an int. If no data is found, null is returned. Note that this method is only good for elements that are unique to an XML file, meaning there is only one of them.
        Parameters:
        doc - Fully-loaded DOM Document corresponding to a loaded XML file from which we are loading the data.
        tagName - Name of the tag (i.e. field name) we are looking to load data for.
        Returns:
        The data in the doc that corresponds to the tagName element. Note that if no data is found, null is returned.

      • getBooleanData

        public java.lang.Boolean getBooleanData(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                        java.lang.String tagName)
        This method extracts the data found in the doc argument that corresponds to the tagName and returns it as a boolean. If no data is found, null is returned. Note that this method is only good for elements that are unique to an XML file, meaning there is only one of them.
        Parameters:
        doc - Fully-loaded DOM Document corresponding to a loaded XML file from which we are loading the data.
        tagName - Name of the tag (i.e. field name) we are looking to load data for.
        Returns:
        The data in the doc that corresponds to the tagName element. Note that if no data is found, null is returned.

      • getNodeInSequence

        public org.w3c.dom.Node getNodeInSequence(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                          java.lang.String tagName,
                                          int index)
        This method can be used for getting Node that appear in a sequence in an XML file. It will return the Node at the index location in the sequence.
        Parameters:
        doc - The XML Document to extract the Node from.
        tagName - The name of the element to be searched for in the doc.
        index - The index location in the sequence of the node we are looking for.
        Returns:
        The node at the index location in the doc.

      • getNumNodesOfElement

        public int getNumNodesOfElement(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                java.lang.String tagName)
        This simple helper method returns the number of nodes found in the doc of the type specified by the tagName argument.
        Parameters:
        doc - Loaded XML DOM tree.
        tagName - Element we're looking for.
        Returns:
        The number of elements of tagName in this doc.

      • getChildNodeWithName

        public org.w3c.dom.Node getChildNodeWithName(org.w3c.dom.Node parent,
                                             java.lang.String tagName)
        This method finds a child node with the tagName argument value as a name in the parent node and returns it. If no child node is found with that name, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        parent - The node to search through for a tagName child.
        tagName - The element name for the tag we're looking for.
        Returns:
        The child node in the parent with an element name of tagName. If not found, return null.
